list_definition.definition: to allow to pass down the throat to the stomach

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His throat was so painful that he could hardly swallow.

list_definition.definition: to accept (eg a lie or insult) without question or protest

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You’ll never get her to swallow that story!

list_definition.definition: a type of insect-eating bird with long wings and a divided tail.

list_ex_of_english: Salivation, swallowing, freezing and sensory complaints were not evaluated.
Fruits of this species are too large to be swallowed by birds other than cassowaries.

In moderate dysphagia, they may need to modify the diet to softer food, which is more easily chewed or swallowed.
Prognostic importance of a therapeutic videoradiographic swallowing study.

Aging influences the structures involved in the swallowing process and may alter the efficiency of the act of swallowing.
